message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to show you our top-of-the-line product. It's a game-changer in its industry and has a lot of potential. I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to make a competitive offer. I'm proposing a price of $12500 for the product. What do you think?
I'm very interested in the product, but $12500 is a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $11000, is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand that $12500 might be a bit steep for you, but I'm still confident that this product has a lot of value to offer. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $12000. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to consider $10800?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting a bit too far apart. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer the product to you for $11500. This is as low as I'm willing to go, but I think it's still a great deal for both of us. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to consider $10500?

I'm not willing to go any lower than $11500, but I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a premium support package and a personalized onboarding session, which normally costs $1000. With this package, I'm willing to sell the product to you for $11500. What do you think?
I appreciate the extras, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. Would you be willing to sell the product to me for $10000?
